result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven C Lange was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Shall pay fine including costs within 60 days or thru payment plan established with Clerk of Courts or shall serve not beyond 22 days in the Dodge County Jail consecutive with huber and transer for failure to pay.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Payment hearing on April 28, 2017 at 08:45 am.
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Steven C Lange in court with attorney Greg Ernest Vollan.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended information filed in court, also e-filed, 1 count hit and run, attended vehicle (MD). Settlement agreement has been reached.  Court reviews PQWOR, Charge/penalty with defendant.  Defendant pleads no contest to amended charge.  Court finds factual base, plea made FVK, finds defendant guilty of amended count 1.  Atty. Klomberg is heard on recommendation.  Atty. Vollan is heard on recommendation.  Mr. Lange is heard.  Court is heard and sentence imposed:

$500 Fine plus costs.  To be paid within 60 days or thru payment plan established with COC.  22 days DCJ with H&T in the alternative.
